thread.title: Pa. boys: Malvern Prep tops GA, stays unbeaten
thread.title_full: Pa. boys: Malvern Prep tops GA, stays unbeaten

title: Pa. boys: Malvern Prep tops GA, stays unbeaten
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports Penn Charter 2, Episcopal Academy 1: The Williams brothers, Conrad and Harrison, scored for the host Quakers. Conrad, a junior midfielder, scored the winner off a free kick midway through the second half. Harrison, a senior, scored four minutes into the first half.
PUBLIC LEAGUE 
Franklin Learning Center 3, Roxborough 1: The visitors scored all their goals in the second half, including two from Mohamed Nana. Sekou Camara scored for the hosts. 
Northeast 5, Southern 0: Christian Escobar netted two goals for the visitors, and Mohamed Elgayar, Adin Hernandez, and Phedel Saye each had one. 
Washington 4, Phila. Academy Charter 0: Desmon Asuva and Wilson Jah each had a goal and an assist for the visitors. Konstantine Paulau made four saves for the shutout. 
Mastbaum 6, Penn Treaty 1: The visitors scored three goals in each half, and Moises Leal and Salem Salem collected hat tricks. Tyler Nessey scored for the hosts. 
Furness 6, Lincoln 1: Ehbow Lwe deposited two goals and Duy Cu, Htoo Htoo, Jawad Kahn, and Arun Subba scored one goal each for the visitors. 
String Theory 4, Edison 2: Kevin Trejo-Hernandez scored twice for the visitors. Mike DaDamo and Moussa Ghadeja each scored one goal. 
Boys' Latin 2, Science Leadership (Beeber) 1: Nate Robinson scored two goals for the hosts and Ayub Sayed collected two assists. 
NONLEAGUE 
Strath Haven 1, Kennett 0: Adam Schultz won a tackle at midfield in the first half for the hosts, and played a through ball down the center of field to spring Scott Campbell for a breakaway. Using his left foot, Campbell tucked it into the left corner. 
Academy Park 4, Ridley 3: Sophomore midfielder Lansana Doumbouya scored two goals, including the tying goal with 18 minutes remaining in the second half. He then assisted on freshman striker Tahjay Swaby's winner with 11 minutes left. WATER POLO 
INTER-AC LEAGUE 
Penn Charter 13, Episcopal Academy 12, 2 OT: Junior Emmett Foley scored the sudden-death winner after two scoreless overtime periods. 
Malvern Prep 16, Germantown Academy 4: Isaac Salinas had six goals for the hosts.
